name: CommissionType
title: Commission Type
description: Types of commission arrangements between carriers and intermediaries.

concept.definition: A fixed percentage of written premium paid to the producing intermediary.
An additional payment earned when the book of business meets specified profitability or volume thresholds.
An additional percentage paid on top of the standard commission, typically for high-performing agencies or specific programs.
A discretionary payment for achieving specific production or profitability targets.
A payment based on the underwriting profit generated by the intermediary's portfolio.
An additional commission paid outside the standard arrangement, often for marketing or service commitments.
A one-time payment for referring new business that results in a bound policy.
